titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Alfred M. Lilienthal papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Linda Bernard

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-08-14T13:38-0700

change.item: Descriptions of reformatted audiovisual items updated.
Revised to update encoding and add unitid.
Edited content and updated coding to conform to OAC.
PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::Alfred M. Lilienthal Papers)//EN" "reg_131.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

physdesc.extent: 260 manuscript boxes, 2 cubic foot boxes, 9 oversize boxes, 1 card file box, 189 envelopes, 2 motion picture film reels

did.abstract: Speeches and writings, correspondence, notes, memoranda, press releases, serial issues, conference papers, interviews, studies, clippings, other printed matter, photographs, motion picture film, and sound recordings relating to the Middle East, Arab-Israeli relations, and American foreign policy in the region. Also available on microfilm (157 reels).

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Use copies of some sound recordings and motion picture film in this collection are available for immediate access. To listen to other sound recordings or to view videos during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Alfred M. Lilienthal papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1982.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Speeches and writings, correspondence, notes, memoranda, press releases, serial issues, conference papers, interviews, studies, clippings, other printed matter, photographs, motion picture film, and sound recordings relating to the Middle East, Arab-Israeli relations, and American foreign policy in the region.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Appointment calendars, articles, bibliographies, biographies, conversation transcripts, correspondence, research files, schedules, clippings, and other printed matter, arranged alphabetically by physical form.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Articles, book drafts, essays, letters to the editor, press releases, radio broadcasts, speeches, and statements, arranged chronologically.
See also: SUBJECT FILE, Arab boycott, NAAA Conference; Bahrain; Israel, Letter-bomb campaign; Media, Writings of AML; MIDDLE EAST PERSPECTIVE, Writings of AML.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 2,313 prints, 37 negatives, 146 negative strips, 13 contact sheets, and 13 slides depicting Lilienthal and others in the United States and in various countries of the Middle East.

did.unittitle: 24 prints depicting AML, including 1 dressed as a Saudi prince at Nantucket and 1 behind the wheel of boat belonging to Parade Magazine editor Motley
7 prints depicting AML during speaking engagements and interviews,
5 prints depicting books written by AML and clippings mentioning AML

15 prints depicting AML and other members of United Youth for Defense, Douglas Fairbanks, Jr., General Hershey (head of draft), and former Midwest Governor Paul McNutt, as well as with Jackie Cooper and Alice Marble,
3 prints depicting AML in uniform in San Francisco as a consultant to the U.S. Delegation at the UN Conference,
1 print depicting AML with members of the One World Club in Washington, D.C.,

4 prints and 1 negative depicting AML in Egypt interviewing Gamal Abdel Nasser for NBC, ; with Prime Minister Mohamed Naguib, U.S. Secretary of State John Foster Dulles, and Harold E. Stassen, 11 May 1953; and with Mahmoud Younes,
21 prints, 13 contact strips, and 4 negatives depicting AML visiting refugee camps in Gaza with Colonel Salah Gohar (before being stranded there for one month),
1 print depicting AML in Jerusalem with Rabbi Benjamin of Neturei Karta,
4 prints depicting AML in Lebanon at a press conference of Adlai Stevenson and John Foster Dulles at the American University of Beirut Alumni Club, print depicting Stevenson's son Borden
5 prints and 7 slides depicting AML visiting refugee camps with Adlai Stevenson and Wilton Wynn in the Bakaa Valley,

5 prints depicting Adlai Stevenson with Camille Chamoun and Saab Salaam at the dedication of a hydroelectric plant in the Bekaa Valley; and 2 prints depicting Lebanese foreign minister George Hakim or Emile Boustany and Izzat Tannous,
2 prints depicting AML with U.S. ambassador to Lebanon Harold Mino,
6 prints and 1 negative depicting AML in Syria with President Adib Shishakly,
1 print depicting AML at the British Empire Club, Providence, Rhode Island,
1 print depicting AML in Iraq in playing water polo with Prime Minister Fadhil Jamali at the Alwiya Club in Baghdad; and 4 prints of Babylon
1 print depicting AML at the Jordan Hospital with head of hospital Dr. Dejani,
10 prints depicting AML arriving in Beirut in met by Mrs. Khartabil, Ludwig Tamari, and Izzat Tannous; and at a reception at the Alumni Club after addressing the Palestinian Arab Women League

20 prints depicting AML in Lebanon with Camille Chamoun, Saab Salaam, and Sami Solh; and at a reception in Beirut given by the Minister of Information Ezzedine N'Souli, with Permanent Undersecretary Fouad Amoun and Wilton Wynn of AP,
3 prints depicting AML visiting refugee camps in Lebanon,

20 prints and 2 negatives depicting AML in Egypt in 1954, including with Mohamed Naguib, Wilton Wynn, and Kennett Love during the celebration of the first anniversary of Egyptian Revolution outside of Alexandria; addressing the Rotary Club at the Nile Hilton in Cairo on ; and at a press conference given by Gamal Abdel Nasser
9 prints depicting AML during his first visit in Saudi Arabia, including with Sheik Khalid Abdul Walid, Sheik Yousuf Yasin, and Minister of Information Abdullah Bulkair,
21 prints depicting AML in Syria in 1954, at a press conference in Aleppo and at the opening of the Damascus Fair, where copies of What Price Israel? are on display
8 prints depicting AML with Gamal Abdel Nasser at his home, Minister of Economy Abdul Mouneim Kaissouny, and Minister of the Interior Zakharia Mohieddine,
5 prints depicting AML giving two different press conferences, one at the Semiramis Hotel in Cairo, with Wilton Wynn and Ibrahim Izzrat in the audience
11 prints depicting AML visiting Lebanon President Camille Chamoun in his summer residence at Beit Eldin,
51 prints depicting AML in Lebanon, including with Izzat Tannous, at various functions and at Baalbek on after a reception at the US Embassy

18 prints depicting AML in Egypt, including with Anwar Sadat, with Egyptian Jews visiting a synagogue, with journalist Dorothy Thompson; smoking a narguilla; and with famed belly-dancer Nadia Gammal. Includes an autographed picture of Anwar Sadat
20 prints depicting AML speaking at the Propeller Club in Beirut, and at the airport leaving for Amman, where the plane was held for him as he was visiting King Hussein
1 print depicting AML after a lecture in the Midwest,

16 prints of AML in Cologne, Germany, with UN armed forces before leaving for Cairo; and in Jerusalem attending an Easter service with General E. L. M. Burns, and at unidentified locations in the Middle East,
142 prints of AML in Jerusalem at Easter and in Jordan, including at the opening of Parliament; with King Hussein and his Circasian guard; and at Mandelbaum Gate and Church of the Holy Sepulchre
39 prints of AML at Kalandra and other refugee camps in Jordan and among ruins of Israeli raid,

52 prints of AML at Ismailia, Egypt, with Suez Canal Co. president Mahmoud Younes and with children of Ismailia, and on a visit to the Sphinx. Includes prints of ships in the Canal and of new housing in Suez after the war, as well as of AML with Egyptian military, and at al Gamma en route to Alamein

37 prints, 2 negatives, and 6 strips of negatives of AML, mostly in Bahrain, including with Emir Issa Khalifa; at in Kuwait with Al Qabbas J ; with Austrian Chancellor Bruno Kreisky; with a Qatari editor; and with Mayor of Nablus and Mrs. Bassam Shakaa in London after the attempted assassination in a West Bank car bombing in which he lost his leg
42 prints and 15 strips of negatives of AML in Saudi Arabia, mostly at ARAMCO installations and at the University of Dahrain,
12 prints of AML in Vienna, Austria, speaking at the International Progress Organization Conference on Palestine,
57 prints and 18 strips of negatives of AML in Prague, Czechoslovakia, including at famed Jewish cemetery, Includes prints of drawings done by Jewish children

16 prints of AML in Dundee, Scotland, receiving a medal from the Lord ; in Lebanon, including with Yasir Arafat; in Jerusalem with Rabbi Hirsh; in Iraq, including with the Vice President Tarek Aziz; and lecturing on the West Bank,
2 prints of AML with Stephen J. Solarz at William Buckley's Firing Line 20th anniversary celebration,
2 prints of AML speaking at the Windsor Hotel in Montreal, Canada, on Palestine Day, (talk broken up by the Maronites)
2 prints of AML with Mohamed T. Mehdi on AP TO AP (Arab People to American People) TV,
74 prints and 23 strips of negatives of AML on a lecture tour in California, Arizona, and Oregon,
1 print of AML in Geneva, Switzerland, for the European Regional Preparatory Meeting of the International Conference on the Question of Palestine,
21 prints and 3 strips of negatives of AML in Tunis, including with Yasir Arafat and Tunisian ambassador to the UN Mohammed Mestieri,
2 prints of AML in Baghdad, Iraq, for the International Conference on the Impact of the Gulf War on World Peace and Security,
1 print of AML at the Egyptian Mission in New York celebrating Egypt's National Day,
2 prints of AML with Senator James Abourezk and Michael Saba
1 print of AML with Mohamed Ali in Chicago, (?)
2 prints of AML with Fathi Arafat, President of the Red Crescent
1 print of AML with Saudi Foreign Minister Suqqaf and Jamil Baroody, Saudi ambassador to the UN
7 prints and 2 strips of negatives of AML in Jerusalem with Bishop Hilarion Capucci
4 prints of Lebanese President Fouad Shehab
2 prints of AML at the Cairo Film Festival with actress Faye Emerson, Egyptian Minister of Education Abdel-Aziz es-said and journalist Ibrahim Ezzat
1 print of AML with Egyptian Foreign Minister Ismael Fahmy
1 print of AML in Damascus, Syria, with Khaled Fahoum, chairman of the Executive Committee of the Palestinian National Council
4 prints of AML in Washington, D.C. and Saudi Arabia with King Faisal
1 print of AML with Asia Halaby in front of her home in Jerusalem
5 prints of UN troops and Secretary-General Dag Hammarskjold in the Middle East,
1 print of AML with Heikal Mohammed Hassanein Richard Nixon, and Robert F. Kennedy
13 prints of King Hussein of Jordan, including with AML, Richard Nixon, and Robert F. Kennedy
1 print of Gunnar Jarring (of the UN Jarring Mission) in Beirut with Wilton Wynn of AP
1 print of Pope John Paul II
1 print of Iraqi Abdul Karim Kassim
2 prints of Austrian chancellor Bruno Kreisky
2 prints of Archbishop Makarios in Qatar with the Emir, Sheik Al-Thani, at a luncheon attended by AML
2 prints of Lebanese Patriarch Paul Meouchie, Lebanese Foreign Minister George Hakim, and Cardinal Spellman,
1 print of AML in Nantucket talking with U.S. Secretary of Navy William Mittendorff
1 print of AML in Jordan with Prime Minister Hazza Majali three days before his assassination
7 prints and 1 negative of Gamal Abdel Nasser, including with AML and Mahmoud Riad visiting Gaza
2 prints of AML with Mr. Noaman of Yemen
1 print of Merle Oberon getting of the same plane AML was in,
1 print of AML with Abdullah Philby,
9 prints of Muammar Qaddafi, including with President Numeiry
2 prints of AML with Kamal Abdul Rahman
3 prints of King Saud, and 1 print of Saudi Foreign Minister Prince Saud bin Faisal shaking hands with AML
1 print of Zehdi Labib Terzi holding a press briefing at the UN,

8 prints depicting AML with foreign dignitaries at various UN receptions, including Jordanian Ambassador Hazem Nusseibeh; Kuwaitian ambassador Abdullah Bishara; PLO representative Farouk Kaddoumi; Iraqi ambassador Adnan Padachi and his wife; and the Tunisian ambassador to the UN Mohammed Mestieri introducing the Tunisian Foreign Minister
2 prints depicting AML at a UN reception put on by the Sudanese delegation
2 prints depicting AML at a UN reception put on by the Omani delegation, for Omani National Day in and at some other time
2 prints depicting AML at the UN with Jordanian ambassador Abdel Moneim Rifai; British member of parliament Margaret McKay; Archbishop Philip Saliba; and Yemeni ambassador Noaman

2 prints depicting AML at the UN with Libyan ambassador Mansour Kikhia; foreign minister Ali Treiki; Secretary of the Arab League Chadli Klibi; Clovis Maksoud; for Libyan National Day in and at some other time
3 prints depicting AML at the UN with UAE ambassador; Madelyn Mallouf; Mrs. Roshan O. Pedder; in and at some other time
3 prints of AML at the UN with UAE Ambassador Saif Ghorbash, Qatar Ambassador Jassim Jamal
1 print depicting AML at the UN with the Saudi consul general
1 print of AML with Saudi Oil Minister Ahmad Zaki Yamani
3 prints of AML in Egypt at night clubs and at the Auberge des Pyramides
3 prints and 1 negative of AML in Kuwait dancing at the home of businessman Bader Mulla, and being interviewed by Kabussi of Al Qabas
3 prints of AML in Lebanon at party honoring him
11 prints of unidentified people and 1 one of AML with Algerian ambassador and Mrs. Benhima
10 prints depicting Lebanon and Jordan, including the Middle East shelf at the American University of Beirut Library
9 prints depicting various pro-Israel demonstrations in New York City
4 prints depicting Saudi Arabia, including 1 of a convicted Saudi with hand severed
3 prints depicting the Tunisian Trade and Tourist Office in New York City
1 print depicting a scene from the film Lawrence of Arabia
8 prints depicting Ingrid Bergman in the film Golda
19 prints depicting Anthony Quinn and others in the film Mohammad, Messenger of God
